p: Several studies regarding the composition of the essential oil from Mesosphaerum suaveolens (syn. Hyptis suaveolens) were published up to the present time ( Table 2). The specimens were collected in different parts of the world including Australia, Brazil, Cameroon, Cuba, China, El Salvador, Guinea-Bissau, India, Italy, Laos, Nigeria and Venezuela. Although the plants have different origins, the chemical composition is somewhat similar, being sabinene ( 246), 1,8-cineole ( 250) and Î²-caryophyllene ( 262) the most abundant components cited in the majority of the reports.
